intro: Anil tinctoria var. neglecta, commonly known as the Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces red-colored roots that have been historically used as a natural dye. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its traditional use in dyeing textiles and its potential for medicinal applications.
